item.title: Expert 3, Spécialiste en SIG, Catégorie I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation PIR/Pastoralisme

Objectif général :

Apporter une assistance technique à l’identification et à la formulation du sous-programme Pastoralisme et transhumance du PIR 11e FED.

Objectifs spécifiques :

  • Proposer et argumenter le choix dans le PRIDEC de la ou des parties correspondant le mieux aux priorités de la CEDEAO et de l’UEMOA en matière de transhumance et pastoralisme, et au concept du sous-programme Pastoralisme et transhumance du PIR 11e FED.
  • Formuler le Document d’Action/Identification.
  • Formuler le Document d’Action/Formulation qui sera la base de la convention de financement du programme.

Project duration : 240 days

Expert 3, Spécialiste en SIG, Catégorie I

Qualifications et compétences :

Spécialiste des systèmes d’information géographique (SIG), possédant les diplômes supérieurs appropriés : géographie, informatique, etc.

Expérience professionnelle générale :

  • Expert avec un minimum de 12 années d’expérience, disposant d’une compétence en géographie et en informatique appliquées au développement, avec un minimum de 3 missions de planification, mise en oeuvre ou suivi/évaluation des politiques agricoles durables.
  • Il dispose d'une compétence démontrée dans au moins 3 projets dans le domaine de la politique agricole durable.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique :

Exigences minimales

  • Il dispose d’une bonne expérience en matière d'appui institutionnel et organisationnel dans le secteur agricole et rural avec un minimum de 5 années d’expérience professionnelle dans le secteur de l'appui institutionnel.
  • Une expertise en SIG pour le développement rural, la planification et le suivi est nécessaire.
  • Il maîtrise le cycle des projets de développement.
  • Il dispose d'une expérience en Afrique subsaharienne.

Exigences préférentielles:

Seront considérés comme des atouts une expérience en pastoralisme, en décentralisation, et en commerce transfrontalier en Afrique.

L'expert prestera au maximum 70 jours selon la répartition indicative suivante :

  • 54 jours dans 6pays sur les 8 concernés ;
  • 16 jours au lieu de résidence pour la documentation et la rédaction des rapports.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert 2, Expert en politique de l’élevage, Catégorie I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation PIR/Pastoralisme

Objectif général :

Apporter une assistance technique à l’identification et à la formulation du sous-programme Pastoralisme et transhumance du PIR 11e FED.

Objectifs spécifiques :

  • Proposer et argumenter le choix dans le PRIDEC de la ou des parties correspondant le mieux aux priorités de la CEDEAO et de l’UEMOA en matière de transhumance et pastoralisme, et au concept du sous-programme Pastoralisme et transhumance du PIR 11e FED.
  • Formuler le Document d’Action/Identification.
  • 3Formuler le Document d’Action/Formulation qui sera la base de la convention de financement du programme.

Project duration : 240 days

Expert 2, Expert en politique de l’élevage, Catégorie I

Qualifications et compétences :

Spécialiste des politiques publiques de l’élevage et en santé animale (gouvernance vétérinaire, épizooties, zoonoses et contrôle des maladies animales transfrontalières), hautement qualifié, possédant les diplômes supérieurs appropriés dans un des domaines suivants : zootechnie, science vétérinaire, développement rural, administration publique et/ou diplôme lié à la politique publique.

Expérience professionnelle générale

  • Expert avec un minimum de 12 années d’expérience dans les politiques publiques de l’élevage, en gouvernance vétérinaire et santé animale, dont 5 ans en Afrique subsaharienne.
  • Il dispose d'une compétence avérée (au moins 3 projets) dans la gestion et les réformes du secteur public, les politiques communautaires en Afrique, et le développement institutionnel régional.
  • Il dispose d'une compétence démontrée (au moins 3 projets) de formulation et/ou d'évaluation de programmes d’appui à l’élevage et dans le domaine de la gouvernance vétérinaire, et a effectué au moins 3 missions de planification, mise en oeuvre ou suivi-évaluation des politiques de transhumance et de pastoralisme.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Exigences minimales :

  • Il possède une bonne connaissance, acquise en Afrique subsaharienne, des finances publiques, de la socio-économie, du partenariat public-privé avec les organisations professionnelles et les organisations de la société civile en élevage.
  • Il dispose d’une expertise en surveillance épidémiologique et d’une expérience de 5 ans au moins en appui institutionnel et organisationnel dans le secteur de la prévention et de la lutte contre les maladies animales transfrontalières.
  • Il maîtrise le cycle des projets de développement.
  • Il dispose d'une expérience en Afrique de l’ouest.

Exigences préférentielles :

Seront considérés comme des atouts une expérience en pastoralisme, en décentralisation, en commerce transfrontalier en Afrique, et en procédures du FED régional.

L'expert prestera au maximum 70 jours selon la répartition indicative suivante :

  • 54 jours dans 6pays sur les 8 concernés ;
  • 16 jours au lieu de résidence pour la documentation et la rédaction des rapports.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.title: Chef de mission. Expert 1, Pastoraliste, Catégorie
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation PIR/Pastoralisme

Objectif général :

Apporter une assistance technique à l’identification et à la formulation du sous-programme Pastoralisme et transhumance du PIR 11e FED.

*Objectifs spécifiques : *

  • Proposer et argumenter le choix dans le PRIDEC de la ou des parties correspondant le mieux aux priorités de la CEDEAO et de l’UEMOA en matière de transhumance et pastoralisme, et au concept du sous-programme Pastoralisme et transhumance du PIR 11e FED.
  • Formuler le Document d’Action/Identification.
  • Formuler le Document d’Action/Formulation qui sera la base de la convention de financement du programme.

Project duration: 240 days

*Chef de mission. Expert 1, Pastoraliste, Catégorie I *

Qualifications et compétences

Spécialiste du pastoralisme et de la transhumance, notamment transfrontalière, hautement qualifié, possédant les diplômes supérieurs appropriés dans un des domaines suivants : zootechnie, science vétérinaire, agronomie, géographie, environnement, développement rural et/ou diplôme lié au pastoralisme.

Expérience professionnelle générale

Expert avec un minimum de 12 années d’expérience dans des projets de développement, dont 5 ans en Afrique subsaharienne, et disposant d’une compétence avérée dans au moins 3 projets dans le domaine du pastoralisme et de la transhumance, et une compétence relative à l'aide européenne.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Exigences minimales

  • Il dispose d'une expertise avérée dans au moins 3 pays ouest-africains (sahéliens et côtiers) sur les meilleures pratiques favorisant le pastoralisme et la transhumance : alimentation et soin des ruminants, différents biotopes pastoraux en Afrique, types de pasteurs, types de mobilité des troupeaux, organisation professionnelle des éleveurs et des agriculteurs, filières bétail-viande, etc.
  • Il dispose également d’une bonne expérience en matière d'appui institutionnel et organisationnel dans le secteur rural avec au moins 5 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l'appui institutionnel.
  • Il possède une expérience en procédures du FED.
  • Il maîtrise le cycle des projets de développement.

Exigences préférentielles :

Seront considérés comme des atouts une expérience en décentralisation, en commerce transfrontalier en Afrique, et en procédures du FED régional.

L'expert prestera au maximum 70 jours selon la répartition indicative suivante :

  • 54 jours dans 6 pays sur les 8 concernés ;
  • 16 jours au lieu de résidence pour la documentation et la rédaction des rapports.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Administrative Assistant – Expertise in IT & Databases used for CfP
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the assessment of proposals received under the PanAf CSO call for proposals

GLOBAL OBJECTIVE

To recruit assessors to assist the European Commission in the evaluation and selection of the best proposals received under EuropeAid/150550/DH/ACT/Multi and to achieve a high quality, complete and coherent selection process of projects in line with the criteria set in the guidelines for grant applicants.

SPECIFIC OBJECTIVE

To provide technical support to the services of the European Commission in order to reach the global objective, as regards both the technical and the financial assessment of the proposals received.

Project Duration: 200 days

Administrative Assistant – Expertise in IT & Databases used for CfP

  • Be IT proficient and master the use of the usual IT applications (word processors, spreadsheets, databases and email);
  • Have a work experience in a multicultural environment could be considered an asset;
  • Have working knowledge of IT systems and databases used in the processing of calls for proposals and administrative/eligibility assessment experience will be considered an asset;
  • Be proficient in English and have good command of French.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: 8 Assessors – Junior Experts with Experience related to one of Thematic Lots of CfP + EU Development Policy
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the assessment of proposals received under the PanAf CSO call for proposals

GLOBAL OBJECTIVE

To recruit assessors to assist the European Commission in the evaluation and selection of the best proposals received under EuropeAid/150550/DH/ACT/Multi and to achieve a high quality, complete and coherent selection process of projects in line with the criteria set in the guidelines for grant applicants.

SPECIFIC OBJECTIVE

To provide technical support to the services of the European Commission in order to reach the global objective, as regards both the technical and the financial assessment of the proposals received.

Project Duration: 200 days

8 Assessors – Junior Experts with Experience related to one of Thematic Lots of CfP + EU Development Policy

Each assessor must:

  • Hold a university level education in Law, Political Sciences, International Relations, Development Studies or other relevant subject;
  • Be a junior expert with at least 3 years of professional experience related to – at least- one thematic lots of the call for proposals (democracy, governance, human rights, peace and security issues and gender issues), involvement of civil society organisations and other related topics;
  • Have knowledge of EU development policy;
  • Have experience in project management and/or monitoring experience;
  • Be proficient in English and have good command of French with ability to read proposals and review quality of proposals assessments;
  • Experience in assessing proposals submitted under European Union calls for proposals will be considered an asset;
  • Work experience in developing countries and in particularly in Africa will be considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Co-Ordinator. Senior Expert in Civil Society or Areas covered by CfP and EU Policies/Programmes
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the assessment of proposals received under the PanAf CSO call for proposals

*GLOBAL OBJECTIVE *

To recruit assessors to assist the European Commission in the evaluation and selection of the best proposals received under EuropeAid/150550/DH/ACT/Multi and to achieve a high quality, complete and coherent selection process of projects in line with the criteria set in the guidelines for grant applicants.

SPECIFIC OBJECTIVE

To provide technical support to the services of the European Commission in order to reach the global objective, as regards both the technical and the financial assessment of the proposals received.

Project Duration: 200 days

Co-Ordinator. Senior Expert in Civil Society or Areas covered by CfP and EU Policies/Programmes

  • Hold a University level education in Law, Political Sciences, International Relations, Development Studies or other relevant subject;
  • Be a senior expert with at least 10 years of professional experience related to one or more of the areas covered by the call for proposals (democracy, governance, human rights, peace and security issues and gender issues), involvement of civil society organisations and other related topics;
  • Have knowledge of EU policies and programmes, particularly in the area of democracy, human rights, peace and security and gender;
  • Have team management, project management and/or monitoring and coordination experience;
  • Be proficient in English and have good command of French with ability to read proposals and review quality of proposals assessments;
  • Previous experience as coordinator in evaluation of calls for proposals will be considered an asset;
  • Have working knowledge of IT systems and databases used in the processing of calls for proposals and administrative/eligibility assessment experience will be considered an asset;
  • Work experience in developing countries and in particularly in African countries will be considered an asset;
  • Knowledge of the work of the institutions/organs of the African Union will be considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Expert in Integrated Coastal Zone Management and Climate Change Policy
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of the GCCA Support Project to the Gambia

Overall objective of this project is to contribute to the capability of the government and people of The Gambia to adapt to increased climate variability and change.

Senior Expert in Integrated Coastal Zone Management and Climate Change Policy (Cat. I)

  • Master’s degree of equivalent in the area relevant to the assignments such as environmental sciences, climate change, management of natural resources, land management and planning, geography or economy or relevant professional experience of 3 years duration (above the general professional experience below);
  • General professional experience of at least 12 years in an area relevant to the assignment;
  • Proven international experience with evaluations, sector assessment, project/programme planning and execution and development exercises in the field of Integrated Coastal Zone Management and Climate Change Policy;
  • An experience in the EU sector policies and strategic orientations and practical knowledge of the EU cooperation in the area relevant to the assignment;
  • Experiences in least developed countries with fragile institutional context;
  • Fluent in English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Spécialiste Senior de l’environnement
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
*Assistance technique a l'ordonnateur regional pour la programmation du 11eme FED des PTOM de la region Pacifique * La mission principale sera d’assister la Nouvelle-Calédonie en tant qu’OR à l’élaboration du projet de Document de Programmation, ainsi que la signature de la convention de financement. Cette tâche sera effectuée avec la collaboration de toutes les parties impliquées dans la préparation du Document de Programmation et dans le respect des principes et procédures du 11° FED prévus dans la DAO et dans les instructions de programmation.

Objectif global L’objectif principal de la mission est de fournir une assistance technique à la Nouvelle Calédonie en tant qu’OR lors de la phase de préparation des documents prévus pour la programmation des ressources allouées aux PTOM du Pacifique au titre du 11ème FED (enveloppe régionale) ; il s’agit en particulier de la préparation, de l’élaboration et de la rédaction du document de programmation jusqu’à son approbation formelle par les services de la Commission européenne, et de la convention de financement afférente Le programme régional du Pacifique devra prendre en compte l’impact régional des interventions, les études et lorsque cela est pertinent les projets qui sont ou seront mis en oeuvre dans ce contexte.

Objectifs spécifiques Objectif 1 : Faciliter la définition et formuler des recommandations pour la programmation, la conception, la gestion, la mise en oeuvre, le suivi et l’évaluation du programme régional, dans le cadre du 11ème FED Objectif 2 : Faciliter l’organisation des consultations nécessaires dans le cadre du « comité régional de pilotage de la programmation » (CRPP), et avec les pays du groupe ACP du Pacifique et les organisations régionales mandatées (« Duly Mandated Regional Organisations »), tout au long du processus de programmation et en particulier dans le cadre du montage du programme (en préparation des résultats attendus dans la section 2.4). Objectif 3 : Produire et garantir la qualité et la conformité de l’ensemble des composantes du document de programmation du 11ème FED régional PTOM - Océan Pacifique (partie A, Document d'Action lors de la phase d'identification, partie B – Document d'Action lors de la phase de formulation), y inclus ses annexes, au regard de la règlementation européenne applicable. Objectif 4 : Produire et garantir la qualité et la conformité du projet de la convention de financement du 11ème FED entre l’Union européenne et la Nouvelle Calédonie en tant qu’OR concernant le programme régional, y inclus ses annexes (et notamment).

Project Location: Nouvelle-Calédonie, Wallis et Futuna et Polynésie Française, Nouvelle Zélande, Fidji

Spécialiste de l’environnement

Formation: Niveau Master en environnement, sciences de l’environnement ou droit de l’environnement.

Experience: Prérequis :

  • Au minimum 12 années d’expérience dans le domaine des politiques publiques en matière d’environnement et du changement climatique
  • Connaissances et expériences dans le domaine de l’environnement et la gestion des ressources naturelles, le changement climatique et la prévention des risques de catastrophes naturelles
  • Si possible connaissance du contexte naturel, culturel et politique des PTOM européens du Pacifique et de l'environnement socio-culturel océanien
  • Connaissance des outils informatiques
  • Aptitude à évaluer la capacité institutionnelle des institutions impliquées dans la mise en oeuvre de programmes de développement

Langue: *Exigée *:

  • Parfait maîtrise du français, lu, écrit et parlé. La langue de cette mission est le français
  • Bonne connaissance de la langue anglaise lu, écrite et parlée

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Spécialiste de la planification et la gestion de projet et de la coopération régionale
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assistance technique a l'ordonnateur regional pour la programmation du 11eme FED des PTOM de la region Pacifique (Cat.I)

La mission principale sera d’assister la Nouvelle-Calédonie en tant qu’OR à l’élaboration du projet de Document de Programmation, ainsi que la signature de la convention de financement. Cette tâche sera effectuée avec la collaboration de toutes les parties impliquées dans la préparation du Document de Programmation et dans le respect des principes et procédures du 11° FED prévus dans la DAO et dans les instructions de programmation.

Objectif global L’objectif principal de la mission est de fournir une assistance technique à la Nouvelle Calédonie en tant qu’OR lors de la phase de préparation des documents prévus pour la programmation des ressources allouées aux PTOM du Pacifique au titre du 11ème FED (enveloppe régionale) ; il s’agit en particulier de la préparation, de l’élaboration et de la rédaction du document de programmation jusqu’à son approbation formelle par les services de la Commission européenne, et de la convention de financement afférente Le programme régional du Pacifique devra prendre en compte l’impact régional des interventions, les études et lorsque cela est pertinent les projets qui sont ou seront mis en oeuvre dans ce contexte.

Objectifs spécifiques Objectif 1 : Faciliter la définition et formuler des recommandations pour la programmation, la conception, la gestion, la mise en oeuvre, le suivi et l’évaluation du programme régional, dans le cadre du 11ème FED Objectif 2 : Faciliter l’organisation des consultations nécessaires dans le cadre du « comité régional de pilotage de la programmation » (CRPP), et avec les pays du groupe ACP du Pacifique et les organisations régionales mandatées (« Duly Mandated Regional Organisations »), tout au long du processus de programmation et en particulier dans le cadre du montage du programme (en préparation des résultats attendus dans la section 2.4). Objectif 3 : Produire et garantir la qualité et la conformité de l’ensemble des composantes du document de programmation du 11ème FED régional PTOM - Océan Pacifique (partie A, Document d'Action lors de la phase d'identification, partie B – Document d'Action lors de la phase de formulation), y inclus ses annexes, au regard de la règlementation européenne applicable. Objectif 4 : Produire et garantir la qualité et la conformité du projet de la convention de financement du 11ème FED entre l’Union européenne et la Nouvelle Calédonie en tant qu’OR concernant le programme régional, y inclus ses annexes (et notamment)

Project Location: Nouvelle-Calédonie, Wallis et Futuna et Polynésie Française, Nouvelle Zélande, Fidji

*Spécialiste de la planification et la gestion de projet et de la coopération régionale *

Formation: Niveau Master en gestion de projets et/ou coopération et/ou intégration régionale et/ou développement international

Experience: *Prérequis *:

  • Au minimum 12 années d’expérience dans le domaine des politiques publiques et des relations internationales
  • Connaissance accrue des politiques d’environnement, sciences de l’environnement, droit de l’environnement
  • Connaissance et expérience dans le domaine des procédures européennes notamment du FED, et du cycle de gestion de projet
  • Connaissance du contexte naturel, culturel, politique des PTOM européens du Pacifique
  • Connaissance des outils informatiques
  • Aptitude à évaluer la capacité institutionnelle des institutions impliquées dans la mise en oeuvre de programmes de développement
  • Connaissance des PTOM et de l'environnement socio-culturel océanien
  • Expérience réussie dans au moins 5 missions de ce type
  • Expérience en communication et en interaction avec des acteurs variés : gouvernement, organisations régionales, ONG, associations, etc

Langue: *Exigée *:

  • Parfait maîtrise du français, lu, écrit et parlé. La langue de cette mission est le français.
  • Bonne connaissance de la langue anglaise lu, écrite et parlée

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Short-Term Climate Experts (Category I and II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the EU-India Climate Change Dialogue

Global objective :

The overall objective of the action is to pave the way for a possible EU-India Climate Change Dialogue and Partnership.

Specific objective(s):

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To raise awareness on EU positions and know how in Climate Change and low carbon technologies by engaging Indian stakeholders such as NGOs, think tanks, businesses and Government officials.
  • To gather intelligence on policies and needs in view of facilitating European business and policy-level involvement in India’s Climate Change agenda
  • To initiate cooperative action between the EU and India, in support of mitigation, adaptation and transparency targets of the Paris Agreement.

*Short-Term Climate Experts (Category I and II) *

In coordination with the Delegation’s staff and supervised by the Team leader and the Coordinator, STEs will mainly act as speakers during speaker events or at the closing event. However, they might also be required to provide specific studies in India on climate actions and present their findings. They will be responsible for the preparation of the detailed inputs for the tasks mentioned above in relation to their expertise. They will also be ensuring capacity building/training sessions if required.

It is expected that their in-country presence will for very short appointments to contribute to the speakers event, however longer missions might be requested if the need arise.

All experts proposed will have the following skills and experience:

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Master’s degree in Environment, Engineering or field related to their area of expertise

General Professional Experience:

  • At least twelve (12) years of experience for category I
  • At least six (6) years of experience for category II

Specific Professional Experience

At least four (4) years specific experience in one or more of the following area:

  • European climate change policies
  • Low carbon development and technologies in transport, energy
  • Climate change mitigation and adaptation
  • Greenhouse gas emission monitoring and verification
  • Green economy
  • Business cooperation
  • Technology development and transfer

Language Skills:

  • Excellent command of English (spoken and written) is required.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Key Expert 2 –Coordinator
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the EU-India Climate Change Dialogue

Global objective

The overall objective of the action is to pave the way for a possible EU-India Climate Change Dialogue and Partnership.

Specific objective(s):

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To raise awareness on EU positions and know how in Climate Change and low carbon technologies by engaging Indian stakeholders such as NGOs, think tanks, businesses and Government officials.
  • To gather intelligence on policies and needs in view of facilitating European business and policy-level involvement in India’s Climate Change agenda
  • To initiate cooperative action between the EU and India, in support of mitigation, adaptation and transparency targets of the Paris Agreement.

Key Expert 2 –Coordinator (Category II)

The coordinator, appointed on a half time basis throughout the contract, will support the Team Leader and Short-term experts for the identification of relevant materials and stakeholders, establishing and maintaining contacts with Indian stakeholders, stakeholder consultations, organisation of meetings consolidation of outputs etc. This expertise should be available on the local market.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Master’s Degree or equivalent in a field relevant to the project, or in its absence, a bachelor degree with an equivalent professional experience of at least five (5) years on top of the general experience required below.

General Professional Experience:

  • At least six (6) years of experience in the sector(s) related to the lot 6.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least three (3) years of working experience in India on climate actions and/or clean energies.
  • At least two (2) successful experiences working with the Indian public sector on climate change and/or mitigation

Language Skills:

  • Excellent command of English and Hindi is required, with a level that allows the interaction with all relevant stakeholders.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Key Expert 1 – Team Leader / EU Climate Change Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the EU-India Climate Change Dialogue

Global objective :

The overall objective of the action is to pave the way for a possible EU-India Climate Change Dialogue and Partnership.

Specific objective(s):

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To raise awareness on EU positions and know how in Climate Change and low carbon technologies by engaging Indian stakeholders such as NGOs, think tanks, businesses and Government officials.
  • To gather intelligence on policies and needs in view of facilitating European business and policy-level involvement in India’s Climate Change agenda
  • To initiate cooperative action between the EU and India, in support of mitigation, adaptation and transparency targets of the Paris Agreement.

Key Expert 1 – Team Leader / EU Climate Change Expert (Category I)

The KE 1 is in charge of ensuring the overall achievement of the assignment’s objectives, and coordinates the technical assistance provided and delivery of the requested outputs. In coordination with EU Delegation’s staff, s/he will supervise and steer the work and provide strategic guidance. S/he will be supported by the coordinator and short-term experts. His/her in-country presence will be required for the initial inputs to establish a work plan with the counterparts and for each and every event during the implementation of the contract.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • At least a Master’s Degree or equivalent in the sector(s) related to lot 6 (such as environment, climate change, energy, economics) or a bachelor degree and professional experience of at least five (5) years on top of the general experience required below.

General Professional Experience:

  • At least twelve (12) years of experience in the sector(s) related to the lot 6.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least 5 years of climate change related experience
  • At least one (1) experience in EU Climate Change Policy Advocacy and/or dialogue
  • At least two (2) projects as team leader of a team of experts working on climate actions and/ or policy dialogue on climate change with national authorities;
  • At least two (2) successful experiences of preparing and moderating working groups, experts' seminars and multi-disciplinary teams.

Language Skills:

  • Excellent drafting and editing skills in English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.title: Team Leader, Senior and Junior Experts in EU External Action Policies and Implementation Modalities
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Chapeau Contract, DCI, GD, CIR, Coherence Report and Co-ordination

This is a Chapeau contract which covers three of the European Commission’s external financing instruments (EFIs). Namely the DCI, GD, CIR. It also covers a Coherence Report on the entire set of instruments, and coordination tasks related to ensuring consistency and quality across all the evaluations of the instruments.

Experts will conduct evaluations of all the EFI instruments in parallel, within the period May 2016-July 2017.

Team Leader, Senior and Junior Experts in EU External Action Policies and Implementation Modalities

Must have the following expertise:

  • Working knowledge of EU external action policies, and the implementation modalities.
  • Working knowledge of the international aid and development effectiveness agenda and principles e.g. Global Partnership for effective development co-operation (Busan)
  • Development policy and aid modalities of Member States,
  • Implementation procedures of the entire set of EFIs
  • Compliance checking in the area of policy implementation
  • Evaluation methods and techniques in general and, preferably, of evaluation in the field of external relations and development cooperation; in particular the team needs to demonstrate experience in analytical methods appropriate for evaluation of change, and for the evaluation of contribution
  • Quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis
  • Cross-team coordination skills
  • The Chapeau contract team leader should have excellent communication, team coordination, presentation, report writing and editing skills in English
  • The team should have the ability to function at a high level in English, French, and passive understanding of Spanish and Portuguese.
  • For the Greenland Decision evaluation a high level of Danish is required

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Key Experts 3.1 and 3.2 – Short-Term Urban Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation for an EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership

Global objective

The overall objective of the action is to strengthen the ties between the EU and India on sustainable urbanization, thus paving the road for a possible EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership. This will be done by facilitating European business and policy-level involvement in India’s Smart-Cities and other urbanisation agendas, building on the momentum generated by the EU-Mumbai Partnership and generalising its results to feed into the national agenda.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To further develop the EU-Mumbai Partnership by providing policy advise and technical assistance on sustainable urbanisation to Mumbai and Maharashtra’s agencies and by involving EU companies in urban, environmental and smart city projects; and
  • To generalise its results and make them available for other key Indian cities and the national level, in order to strengthen the ties between the EU and India on urbanisation and prepare a possible EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership to feed into the Government of India’s Smart-Cities and other urbanisation flagship initiatives.

Project duration: 270 days

Key Expert 3.1 – Short-Term Urban Experts (Category I) Key Expert 3.2 – Short Term Urban Experts (Category II)

In coordination with the Delegation’s staff and supervised by the Team leader and the Coordinator, STEs will carry out technical reports and studies on urban issues and present them at workshops. They will be responsible for the preparation of the detailed inputs for the tasks mentioned above in relation to their expertise. They will also be ensuring capacity building/training sessions.

It is expected that their in-country presence will be mostly required for 4 missions during the implementation of the contract, as well as to carry out assessments, if any are needed.

The four missions are divided in:

  • 2 missions will comprise of 10 working days workshops where a team of experts, composed by 1 Cat I expert and 2 or 3 Cat II experts will provide their knowledge through reports and presentations on specific urban issues, which are of high importance to their Indian audience.
  • 2 missions will be made up of 2 speaker series of 1 day, where 3 EU senior experts will present on sustainable urbanisation in the EU.

All experts proposed will have the following skills and experience:

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Master’s degree in Environment, Geography, Engineering, Urban Planning or related field.

General Professional Experience:

  • At least twelve (12) years of experience for category I / At least six (6) years of experience for category II
  • For both categories, at least one (1) previous experience in working with non-EU countries' urban authorities

Specific Professional Experience

Proven working experience in the following areas is required:

  • European Urbanisation policy
  • Urban development, city development
  • Smart Cities,
  • Transport management,
  • Waste management,
  • Sustainable urban technology
  • Urban planning best practices.
  • Urban capacity planning and development
  • Sustainable urban development projects.

Language Skills:

  • Excellent command of English (spoken and written) is required.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Coordinator with Experience in Urban Planning & Development in India (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation for an EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership

*Global objective *

The overall objective of the action is to strengthen the ties between the EU and India on sustainable urbanization, thus paving the road for a possible EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership. This will be done by facilitating European business and policy-level involvement in India’s Smart-Cities and other urbanisation agendas, building on the momentum generated by the EU-Mumbai Partnership and generalising its results to feed into the national agenda.

*Specific objective(s) *

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To further develop the EU-Mumbai Partnership by providing policy advise and technical assistance on sustainable urbanisation to Mumbai and Maharashtra’s agencies and by involving EU companies in urban, environmental and smart city projects; and

  • To generalise its results and make them available for other key Indian cities and the national level, in order to strengthen the ties between the EU and India on urbanisation and prepare a possible EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership to feed into the Government of India’s Smart-Cities and other urbanisation flagship initiatives.

Key Expert 2 –Coordinator with Experience in Urban Planning & Development in India (Category II)

The coordinator, appointed on a half time basis throughout the contract, will support the Team Leader and Short-term experts for the identification of relevant materials and stakeholders, establishing and maintaining contacts with Indian stakeholders, stakeholder consultations, organisation of meetings consolidation of outputs etc. This expertise should be available on the local market.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Master’s Degree or equivalent in a field relevant to the project (such as urbanisation, engineering, law, economics), or in its absence, a bachelor degree with an equivalent professional experience of at least five (5) years on top of the general experience required below.

General Professional Experience:

  • At least six (6) years of experience related to the lot to the sectors covered by lot 6 Environment.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least three (3) years of working experience in Indian urban planning and development.
  • At least two (2) projects managed at programme coordinator level in urban planning or development
  • At least 1 experience working with the public sector in urban planning and development.

Language Skills:

  • Excellent command of English and Hindi is required, with a level that allows the interaction with all relevant stakeholders.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.title: Senior Expert in Urban Planning/Development (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation for an EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership

Global objective The overall objective of the action is to strengthen the ties between the EU and India on sustainable urbanization, thus paving the road for a possible EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership. This will be done by facilitating European business and policy-level involvement in India’s Smart-Cities and other urbanisation agendas, building on the momentum generated by the EU-Mumbai Partnership and generalising its results to feed into the national agenda.

*Specific objective(s) *

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To further develop the EU-Mumbai Partnership by providing policy advise and technical assistance on sustainable urbanisation to Mumbai and Maharashtra’s agencies and by involving EU companies in urban, environmental and smart city projects; and

  • To generalise its results and make them available for other key Indian cities and the national level, in order to strengthen the ties between the EU and India on urbanisation and prepare a possible EU-India Sustainable Urbanisation Partnership to feed into the Government of India’s Smart-Cities and other urbanisation flagship initiatives.

Key Expert 1 – Senior Expert in Urban Planning/Development (TL) (Category I): The KE 1 is in charge of providing high quality expert inputs to ensure the overall achievement of the assignment’s objectives, and coordinate the technical assistance provided and delivery of the requested outputs. In coordination with EU Delegation’s staff, s/he will supervise and steer the work and provide strategic guidance. S/he will be supported by the coordinator and Short-term experts. His/her in-country presence will be required for the initial inputs to establish a work plan with the counterparts and for 2-3 additional missions during the implementation of the contract.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • At least a Master’s Degree or equivalent in a field relevant to this project (such as environment, engineering, natural sciences, economics) or, in its absence, a bachelor degree with five (5) years additional professional experience on top of the general experience required below;

General Professional Experience:

  • At least twelve (12) years of experience related to the sectors covered by lot 6 Environment.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least five (5) years of experience in technical assistance related to urban planning and development, and/or to the implementation of sustainable urban development projects.
  • At least two (2) projects as team leader of a team experts working in urban planning and development with national authorities;
  • At least two (2) successful experiences of preparing and moderating working groups, experts' seminars, and multi-disciplinary teams.

Language Skills:

  • Excellent drafting and editing skills in English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.title: Senior Monitoring and Evaluation Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Due to our expanding portfolio, DAI are looking to supplement our database of independent Senior Monitoring and Evaluation Experts for inclusion in upcoming bids.

  • Senior experts must have over ten years of experience working on donor-funded programmes with various donors;
  • At least 5 years of experience and a proven track record in running M&E systems and developing broad M&E strategies in line with donor requirements;
  • Extensive experience in grants management and the monitoring and evaluation of grant schemes;
  • Experience in the management of M&E teams and interacting with third-party evaluators;
  • Sound knowledge of project cycle management;
  • Literacy in major data base software;
  • Experience in the MENA region;
  • Solid experience in working in fragile, post-conflict and conflict affected states within a rapidly changing context;
  • Fluency in spoken and written English is a must;
  • Knowledge of languages widely spoken in the MENA region would be an advantage, particularly Arabic.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in being included in the DAI Consultants Database please email your CV in EC format to jorn_moeskops@dai We would also like to receive updated CVs from consultants already registered.

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experts in Strategic Environmental and Social Impact Assessment
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Due to our expanding portfolio, DAI are looking to supplement our database of independent consultants with experience in *ESIA *for upcoming bids.

  • Experts should have over 10 years of experience working on donor-funded projects and in donor cooperation in various sectors;
  • Master’s degree in a relevant field;
  • Several years of experience in environmental and social impact assessment techniques;
  • Experience in development policy analysis;
  • Experience in the MENA region in particular would be an asset;
  • Solid experience in working in fragile, post-conflict and conflict affected states within a rapidly changing context;
  • Fluency in English is a must;
  • Knowledge of languages widely spoken in the MENA region, particularly Arabic.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in being included in the DAI Consultants Database please email your CV in EC format to jorn_moeskops@dai We would also like to receive updated CVs from consultants already registered.

item.title: Team Leader, Ethiopia Dairy Development Activity
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Ethiopia Dairy Development Activity

Objectives of the role: The Team Leader will be responsible for the design and implementation of an exciting new initiative to support the development of a commercially sustainable small-holder dairy sector in Ethiopia. Working in partnership with the Ethiopian government and other international organisations involved in dairy development in Ethiopia, the Team Leader will manage a small team of consultants to build the capacity of local farmers to join a commercial supply chain.

Length of the project: It is anticipated that the activity will consist of two separate phases: Phase One is to investigate which areas of the dairy industry require support and propose interventions for investment not currently being addressed by other actors. This will result in a five-year activity design document that will form the basis for Phase Two of the programme. Indicative timing: design phase - 6 months; implementation phase - 54 months.

Project Location: Addis Ababa

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Tertiary degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. agribusiness, dairy science and technology, value chain management)
  • Understanding and experience in the development of commercial dairy sectors, particularly in developing country contexts
  • Experience in the design and implementation of agriculture development activities in Africa, and ideally in Ethiopia
  • Strong project management experience, including managing multiple stakeholders
  • Experience consulting, engaging and collaborating with governments, NGOs, the private sector, project beneficiaries and other stakeholders, and ability to establish credibility rapidly
  • Particular specialism in results-based management (particularly in the use of Results Frameworks or Log Frames), monitoring and evaluation, and reporting to donors
  • Ability to draw on New Zealand dairy expertise and connections to relevant New Zealand organisations
  • Excellent communication and reporting skills

How to apply: please apply on the DAI website via the following link https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=2578

Please note that all profiles are indicative only and therefore subject to change once the ToR is made available

item.title: AWP 2 Projects Review
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
The Beyond WTO Program (B-WTO) was developed in response to a request from the Government of Vietnam (GoV) for donor support to help with managing economic integration and the transition to a market economy following WTO accession. The B-WTO goal is “to strengthen government’s capacity to manage the integration of Vietnam into the global economy and the transition of Vietnam to a socialist market economy”. The immediate objective is “implementation of priority policy actions from the GoV’s Action Plan to enhance Vietnam’s capacity to sustain pro-poor growth (GAP)”.

The remit of this project was a review of the 2nd annual work plan’s implementation (AWP2) of Phase 2 of the B-WTO in May 2013. The objectives of the review were to:

  • Evaluate the project implementation performance and project results relative to the logical framework targets and evaluation criteria.
  • Evaluate the results achieved at the Component and Program’s level according to the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework of the Program.
  • Identify lessons learned from implementation, make recommendations for the remaining duration of the program and the Independent Completion Report process.
